reviews.text: I have been staying at the Ameritania - 2 or 3 times a year - for more than twelve years and I have always found it to be a lovely andpleasant experience. I am a native New Yorker who now lives in the midwest and have been coming back to the city for business and pleasure for 30+ years. Consequently I have stayed in many hotels around midtown and the Ameritania is by far my favorite. The location is great. The rooms are clean and comfortable. As with any large city hotel there are the occasional problems but the staff is excellent at fixing any problem in a quick and effcient manner. The service is first rate. The staff is friendly, helpful, competant, and knowledgeable. Everyone is great but I especially need to single out Sylvia, Indira, and Erin at the Front Desk and Jeff and Mario of the bellmen. They have always gone the extra mile for me. I've read the critical comments posted on the site and I must say that my experience over the last decade vehemently contradicts any of the little complaints I have read. Ameritania is my favorite hotel.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel the morning of the actual stay, so for the short notice and price it was great. The location was where we wanted, just off Times Square which is great. The room was small, again couldn't complain about that. However, what I am mega peeved about is that at check out I wasn't informed of the 4 dollars that I would be charged to my credit card for no reason. We didn't even drink the water in the room. I have emailed several occasions, the main groups website etc etc etc and haven't even got a single response. It's not even the amount of money that's the point, more so the principle of the situation and how many millions of people have they done this too. A tidy profit for them. If they had a genuine reason for the charge, id like to at least know about it. Convinient for Ameritania i'm not in the same country otherwise I pop in and request I have my money back that they charged for whatever!!!!
reviews.title: Wripped off!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here May 4-11, 2012 - we were happy with the hotel and staff. It is centrally located, not too far from Central Park, Times Square, and the subway. Our favorite part was it is just around the corner from The Ed Sullivan Theater (and we got to see The Late Show with David Letterman!) We stayed in room 1005 which is a corner room, nice view out of one window, the other window had construction across the street. The only complaint we have is the 1 slightly large bug that appeared in the bathroom the first night. I reported it and we didnt see any future bugs in the room.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Yes, the location is good but the service generally lacking. A lot of noise outside the rooms and to access the laundry there is only one option in the day. Not believe it is a cost-effective.
reviews.title: noisy and bad laundry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at Ameritania and the location was perfect. We reserved the room via priceline so everything was paid and clear when we checked out. However, upon returning home, we checked our credit card (that you provide for incidentals) which had been charged for our stay inspite of having paid for the whole trip via in advance.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, excellent location, bad accounts!!

reviews.text: I ended up at the Ameritania entirely by accident, having booked a room at a "sister property", the Bentley, across town. When I arrived at the Bentley (late and tired after a long day of work and travel), I ended up shuffling my feet in reception for 10 minutes while they decided they didn't have my prepaid and confirmed room after all. They put me in a cab and 15 lurching minutes later, I was in Times Square and checking into the Ameritania. They were expecting me and treated me like a welcome guest, not a leftover from another hotel. Score.
reviews.title: Slightly above Average -- for a cut-above class...

reviews.text: I was quickly settled in my "classic boutique" room on the 10th floor, and a very pleasant room it was. The creative decor would be familiar to anyone who's ever stayed in a Kimpton hotel... Wild geometric carpet, lots of textures and buttons, but a neat, spare aesthetic in spite of the flourishes. My room was equipped with two double beds, platform jobs with custom mattresses and snow white coverlets. The bed, as it turns out, was seriously comfortable and cocoon like. Score.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The bathroom was small but similarly stylish, with a rainwater shower head and a seemingly impractical no-door enclosure (that worked better than expected). All in all, a very nice room package.
reviews.title: Give it a miss

reviews.text: What's not to love? Well, as many others have noted, even ten floors up, it's noisy. Like, if the air conditioner cycles off (and it does, a lot) you're confronted with stark street noise. In my room, the window seemed to be mishung, which made the sound leakage even worse. If you're like me, you'll wake up a lot in spite of the cozy bed.
reviews.title: Good but i have had better experiences

reviews.text: Would I stay here deliberately? Yes, if the rate was right, I probably would. Nice property, just far enough out of Times Square to escape the tourist trap, er, trap, and a bed to remember.
reviews.title: Terrible service, nice rooms, VERY LOUD!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I got a deal for a one night stay at this hotel from Groupon. We really did not know what to expect from this hotel. We actually arrived around 8:00 a.m. the morning of our check-in, which was not suppose to be until 3:00 p.m. We wanted to see if they would just hold our luggage so that we could do sightseeing until we could check-in that afternoon. To our surprise, they actually let us go ahead and check-in! This made our morning and actually allowed us to have a full day of sightseeing, instead of breaking it up by having to come back to the hotel to check-in.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great, but it depends on where you want to be in the city. It is on the same block as the Ed Sullivan Theater, where David Letterman's show is filmed. There are restaurants and coffee/bagel shops all around it too. We walked just a few blocks to get to Times Square and just a few more to get to Rockefeller Center. Then it was just a few blocks the other direction to Central Park. Obviously, we took the Subway and Taxis to get to lower Manhattan, but still a really convenient location.
reviews.title: Nice updates, good price, but still feels old

reviews.text: The weekend we went was back in January and, knowing my luck, it snowed that morning. The staff were very helpful with our bags, with making sure we had a cab, with keeping the sidewalks out front and the steps leading into the hotel clear of snow and ice. All in all the entire staff were extremely helpful.
reviews.title: first class

reviews.text: The room was kind of small, but that is NYC for you! We had a king size bed and it was just my boyfriend and I, so the space was perfect for us two. However, I wouldn't expect there was much room for anyone else. The only downfall for me was our view was awful. I was hoping to be on a higher floor with a better view, and we were on the 3rd floor with a view of a construction site. I guess it was because we had a deal and didn't necessarily pay full price, but the room itself was great. The bed was super comfortable too!
reviews.title: Good hotel, good price

reviews.text: We could tell there were renovations going on, but it was fine. We only noticed it during the day from the noise, but we were out sightseeing anyways so it didn't bother us. I am sure that once all of the renovations are complete, this hotel will be even more fabulous. The lounge and lobby area is very swanky and modern. The rooms were also designed in a modern way, which felt appropriate for a stay in NYC.
reviews.title: This hotel stay enhanced our N.Y. experience!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in May 2012. The Hotel is clean, well staffed with cordial people. The rooms are spaceous for NYC standards. Everything in the room as above average. It helps that the hotel was renovated in 2011. Location is very close to the theatre district and lots of restaurants are close by. As a bonus, the hotel has a nice, free, continental breakfast. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite reading so many negative views about this hotel we decided to give it a go and were pleasantly surprised. We were on the 9th floor facing the building works opposite but, despite this, we were no more disturbed by noise from there than we were by traffic in nearby Broadway. The lobby looks fine and although the rooms are smaller than other parts of the US they are as big as you'd get in any large city. The bed was a (UK) king size and comfortable enough even though we're used to a superking at home. The pillows were fine. All rooms appear to be exactly the same décor and we loved the enormous mirror (if only we'd had more luggage allowance LOL). The hotel is just a stones throw from Central Park and Times Square with Carnegie Hall just around the corner. It's an easy walk to the Empire State Building and Macy's and has 3 subway stops (on different lines) not too far away.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly and central

reviews.text: I stayed 8 nights. The location is very good, 10 minutes to Central Park and very close to Times Square, which is a place to avoid! The bed was comfortable. The room, while nicely decorated, was small. For a couple it would have been quite cramped. The shower splashed everywhere and towels were quickly soaked. The WiFi was quick, but at $10 a day, or $25 for three days, is too expensive. These days WiFi should be provided free, like toilet paper. Free WiFi would encourage people to choose Ameritania over other hotels.
reviews.title: Good location and wet towels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third visit to New York and our third different hotel and this was the best one yet! Admittedly we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a junior suite but the whole look and feel of the place is just what we are after in a hotel. It is also in a superb location and a short walk from a subway station, Times Square and where you will never go hungry, Hell's Kitchen. This time we can be confident we will be returning to the same hotel!
reviews.title: Best place yet we've stayed in New York!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was in a fab location, close to everything. The rooms were a good size and we had a really nice view. The staff were really friendly and helpful, especially the doorman who helped to sort out our transfers to the airport, when we were leaving. It was mine and my boyfriends first time traveling to new york and I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: New York Experience
